mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Begun in 1582 by Thomas Smythe; bought by the Methuen family in 1745. Additions made prior to 1749; in 1759 Henry Keene provided plans for additions which were carried out by L. Brown in 1761. In 1800 John Nash enlarged the house; in 1845 Bellamy removed Nash's work on the north front, adding the present structure. Brown began the gardens in 1761; completed by H. Repton in 1799. -- Pevsner and Cherry, Wiltshire, 1976 [work]
